story spotlight

In 2024, we understand the importance of improving the energy performance of new buildings by increasing building code requirements, but this alone won’t be enough to achieve a carbon-neutral future by 2050. The existing building stock holds immense potential for the future of energy in Quebec. The best solution lies in energy-efficient renovations, modernizing the existing built environment—commonly referred to in the industry as “retrofitting.” Engineer Fellipe Falluh is the founder of Retrofit Construction, a general contractor and retrofit consultant.
